CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 12 DTG shows lower intermolecular steric hindrance than DTS because of the longer C-Ge bond compared to the C-Si , resulting in the corresponding DTG - containing solar cells exhibiting higher short - current and fill factor.

Let's think step by step.

1. DTG: 1,2-Di-terbutylgermanium (Di-terbutylgermanium is a material where germanium is the central atom)
2. DTS: 1,2-Di-terbutylsilane (Di-terbutylsilane is a material where silicon is the central atom)

So, the Material Name entities in the paragraph are 1,2-Di-terbutylgermanium (DTG) and 1,2-Di-terbutylsilane (DTS).
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

The Material Name entities in the paragraph are:
1. 1,2-Di-terbutylgermanium (DTG)

The other entities mentioned in the paragraph, such as "C-Ge bond", "C-Si bond", "corresponding DTG - containing solar cells", "short - current", and "fill factor", are not Material Name entities, but rather properties or characteristics related to the materials mentioned.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 12 DTG shows lower intermolecular steric hindrance than DTS because of the longer C-Ge bond compared to the C-Si , resulting in the corresponding DTG - containing solar cells exhibiting higher short - current and fill factor.

Let's think step by step.

1. DTG: This is an abbreviation for a specific compound or material. It is a Property Name entity representing a type of organic semiconductor.
2. DTS: This is another abbreviation for a specific compound or material. It is also a Property Name entity representing a type of organic semiconductor.
3. intermolecular steric hindrance: This is a property or characteristic of a material. It refers to the hindrance or obstruction caused by the three-dimensional arrangement of atoms or molecules when they come into close contact with each other.
4. C-Ge bond: This is a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a germanium atom. It is a Property Name entity representing the length of this particular chemical bond.
5. C-Si bond: This is a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a silicon atom. It is also a Property Name entity representing the length of this particular chemical bond.
6. short - current: This is a property or characteristic of a solar cell. It refers to the electric current generated by the solar cell under short-circuit conditions, i.e., when the output terminals are shorted together.
7. fill factor: This is a property or characteristic of a solar cell. It measures the maximum reversible power that can be delivered by a solar cell under a specific load, relative to the maximum power that can be generated under the standard test conditions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. DTG: Organic semiconductor
2. DTS: Organic semiconductor
3. intermolecular steric hindrance: Property of organic semiconductors
4. C-Ge bond: Property of DTG
5. C-Si bond: Property of DTS
6. short-current: Property of solar cells
7. fill factor: Property of solar cells.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| DTG (organic semiconductor) |
| DTS (organic semiconductor) |
| intermolecular steric hindrance (property of organic semiconductors) |
| C-Ge bond (property of DTG) |
| C-Si bond (property of DTS) |
| short-current (property of solar cells) |
| fill factor (property of solar cells) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 12 DTG shows lower intermolecular steric hindrance than DTS because of the longer C-Ge bond compared to the C-Si , resulting in the corresponding DTG - containing solar cells exhibiting higher short - current and fill factor.

Let's think step by step.

1. DTG: This is a chemical compound or material, specifically a type of organic semiconductor. It can be considered a "Property Entity" with the property "type" being "DTG".
2. DTS: Similar to DTG, DTS is also a chemical compound or material, and it can be considered a "Property Entity" with the property "type" being "DTS".
3. intermolecular steric hindrance: This is a physical property or characteristic of the DTG and DTS compounds. It can be considered a "Property Value" with the property "intermolecular steric hindrance".
4. longer C-Ge bond: This is a specific property or characteristic of the DTG compound. It can be considered a "Property Value" with the property "length of C-Ge bond".
5. C-Si bond: This is a specific property or characteristic of the DTS compound. It can be considered a "Property Value" with the property "length of C-Si bond".
6. short - current: This is a physical property or characteristic of the solar cells containing DTG. It can be considered a "Property Value" with the property "short current".
7. fill factor: This is a physical property or characteristic of the solar cells containing DTG. It can be considered a "Property Value" with the property "fill factor".
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. longer C-Ge bond: This is a specific property or characteristic of the DTG compound. It can be considered a "Property Value" with the property "length of C-Ge bond".
2. C-Si bond: This is a specific property or characteristic of the DTS compound. It can be considered a "Property Value" with the property "length of C-Si bond".
3. higher short - current: This is a physical property or characteristic of the solar cells containing DTG. It can be considered a "Property Value" with the property "short current" for DTG-based solar cells.
4. higher fill factor: This is a physical property or characteristic of the solar cells containing DTG. It can be considered a "Property Value" with the property "fill factor" for DTG-based solar cells.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value                                   |
|----------------------------------------------|
| longer C-Ge bond (specific to DTG)            |
| C-Si bond (specific to DTS)                  |
| higher short - current (for DTG-based cells)    |
| higher fill factor (for DTG-based cells)        |
